<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:2.00PT SOLID #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:2.00PT SOLID #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">
<B>
	Effect on the financial
<BR>
	statements or other
<BR>
	significant matters
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT">
<TD HEIGHT="8">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:9PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	ASU 2016-02,
<I>
	Leases (Topic 842)
</I>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	The standard will require lessees to recognize a right-of-use asset and a lease liability for virtually all of their leases (other than leases that meet the definition of a short-term lease). The liability will be equal to the
	present value of lease payments. The asset will be based on the liability, subject to adjustment, such as for initial direct costs. Lessor accounting is similar to the current model, but updated to align with certain changes to the lessee model
	(e.g., certain definitions, such as initial direct costs, have been updated) and the new revenue recognition standard.
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	January 1, 2019
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	The Company is currently evaluating the effect of the standard on its financial statements and related disclosures.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT">
<TD HEIGHT="8">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:9PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
<I>
<U>
	Standards that were adopted
</U>
</I>
</B>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:9PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	ASU No.&nbsp;2015-03,
<I>
	Interest-Imputation of Interest (Subtopic 835-30): Simplifying the Presentation of Debt Issuance Costs
</I>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	The standard requires debt issuance costs related to a recognized debt liability to be presented in the balance sheet as a direct deduction from the corresponding debt liability rather than as an asset.
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2014
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	The Company early adopted this ASU in connection with its annual reporting period ended December 31, 2014. This resulted in the reclassification of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	$
</FONT>
	4.3 million of debt issue costs, which had
	been previously reported within other assets, to offset the bank debt balance on the balance sheet.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT">
<TD HEIGHT="8">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:9PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	ASU 2015-17,
<I>
	Income Taxes&#151;Balance Sheet Classification of Deferred Taxes
</I>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	The standard requires all deferred tax liabilities and assets to be presented in the balance sheet as noncurrent.
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	December 31, 2014
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	The Company early adopted this ASU in connection with its annual reporting period ended December 31, 2014. In light of the process simplification provided by this ASU, this resulted in the reclassification of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	$
</FONT>
	2.3 million of current deferred tax assets from current assets to long-term assets.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PX; ">
<TD COLSPAN="7" VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; BORDER-TOP:1.00PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
</TR>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>

	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-14
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage161"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D179389DS1A_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:16PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	J.A. Cosmetics Holdings, Inc. and subsidiaries
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:16PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Notes to consolidated financial statements
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Note 3&#151;Acquisition of JACUS and subsidiaries
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	On January&nbsp;31, 2014 (the &#147;Acquisition Date&#148;), the Company acquired 100% of the outstanding shares of capital stock of JACUS, a developer and marketer of
	branded value-priced cosmetics, from the Sellers.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	JACUS serves as the operating entity of the Company and was incorporated in the State of Delaware in November 2010.
	Wholesale operations of JACUS consist of sales to retailers in the United States and international distributors in various countries including Australia, Canada and France. JACUS has a warehouse distribution center in New Jersey. Products are also
	sold directly to consumers through e.l.f. stores located in the New York metro area and online operations. JACUS&#146;s products are developed and marketed under the e.l.f. Cosmetics brand name.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The total purchase price was
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	271.0 million consisting of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	239.1 million in cash (
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	237.9 million net of cash acquired), the issuance of 29,978 shares
	of the Company&#146;s convertible preferred stock and 6,126 shares of its common stock with an aggregate fair value of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	30.0 million, and contingent consideration of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	1.9 million related to certain pre-acquisition tax benefits payable to the Seller. As of December&nbsp;31, 2015,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	1.9 million of the tax benefit payable to the Seller remained unpaid.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	To fund the cash portion of the acquisition, the Company
	raised, in aggregate,
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	250.0 million, of which
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	145.0 million was drawn down from two credit
	facilities and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	105.0 million was contributed by TPG (through TPG Elf Holdings, LP, a wholly-owned subsidiary of TPG, and co-investors) and various other parties including
	certain executives of the Company and several of the credit facility lenders, in exchange for 105,063 shares of the Company&#146;s convertible preferred stock and 21,467 shares of common stock. In connection with the arrangement of the credit
	facilities, the Company incurred, in aggregate,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	5.3 million in deferred financing costs. Refer to Note 8 for further discussion of credit facilities.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
<I>
	Purchase price allocation
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The Company has accounted for the acquisition
	as a business combination in accordance with ASC 805, whereby the purchase price paid to effect the acquisition was allocated to tangible assets acquired, liabilities assumed and identifiable intangible assets acquired based on their estimated fair
	values with the excess of the purchase consideration over the aggregate fair values recorded as goodwill. The value of goodwill was 58% of the total purchase consideration and is primarily attributable to the assembled workforce and expected future
	growth. The goodwill is not deductible for tax purposes.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The acquisition provided the Company with three intangible assets: (i)&nbsp;customer relationships with
	useful lives ranging from three to 10 years, (ii)&nbsp;favorable leases with useful lives ranging from 27 to 71 months and (iii)&nbsp;an indefinite-lived trademark (See Note 4&#151;Goodwill and intangible assets). The customer relationships asset
	represents the value resulting from the Company&#146;s relationships with its retail customers and e-commerce consumers. The favorable leases asset represents the value associated with the leasehold interests associated with the Company&#146;s
	office and warehouse locations in New York and New Jersey. The trademark asset represents the value resulting from the popularity and recognition of the e.l.f. Cosmetics brand. The fair values of the acquired customer relationships were based on the
	excess earnings method and are subject to amortization on a straight-line basis over their remaining useful lives. The fair values of the acquired favorable leases were based on the difference between the actual lease rates and the-then current
	market rent for similar properties in those locations. The fair value of the acquired trademark was based on the relief from royalty method. In addition, the acquisition resulted in a fair market adjustment to acquired inventory of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	1.3 million, the fair value of which was based on the expected selling price less disposal costs and a reasonable profit margin. The Company incurred
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	2.8 million in acquisition-related costs, which were expensed and included within selling, general and administrative expenses in the Successor 2014 Period.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-15
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage162"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D179389DS1A_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
<I>
	Unaudited pro forma financial information
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	In accordance with ASC 805, the following unaudited pro forma financial information presents the combined results of continuing operations for the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2014, as if the acquisition had been completed on January&nbsp;1, 2014. Unaudited pro forma financial information is not required to be presented for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 as the actual combined results of the
	acquisition are already reflected in the consolidated financial statements for this period. The unaudited pro forma results do not reflect any operating efficiencies or potential cost savings that may result from the consolidation of operations.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The unaudited pro forma financial information should not be relied upon as necessarily being indicative of the historical results that would have been obtained if
	the acquisition had actually occurred on that date or the results that will be obtained in the future.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The Company did not recognize any impairment charges during the Successor 2014 Period or the Successor 2015 Period. Amortization expense
	on the finite-lived intangible assets amounted to
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	11,000,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	7.6 million and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	8.2 million in the Predecessor 2014 Period, the Successor 2014 Period and Successor 2015 Period, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	As a result of the acquisition, the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	0.7 million carrying value of the Predecessor&#146;s goodwill
	as of January&nbsp;31, 2014, was eliminated and new goodwill was recorded by the Successor on February&nbsp;1, 2014. In addition, the Predecessor&#146;s
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	0.6 million in
	historical finite-lived intangible assets was stepped-up to fair value at the time of the acquisition by the Successor. The Predecessor did not recognize any impairment charges during the Predecessor 2014 Period.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The estimated future amortization expense related to the finite-lived intangible assets, assuming no impairment as of December&nbsp;31, 2015, is as follows (in
	thousands):
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;

<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">

	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:16PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	J.A. Cosmetics Holdings, Inc. and subsidiaries
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:16PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Notes to consolidated financial statements
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Depreciation and amortization expense on property and equipment were
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	30,000,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	0.4 million and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	2.0 million in the Predecessor 2014
	Period, the Successor 2014 Period and the Successor 2015 Period, respectively. Included in depreciation and amortization of property and equipment is amortization expense for store fixtures which were
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	0,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	3,000 and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	1.3 million for the Predecessor 2014 Period, the
	Successor 2014 Period and the Successor 2015 Period, respectively. There were no store fixtures during the Predecessor 2014 Period.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:16PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Note 6&#151;Fair
	value of financial instruments
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The fair value of foreign currency forward contracts and bank debt are categorized based upon the level of judgment associated
	with the inputs used to measure their fair values. Fair value is measured using inputs from the three levels of the fair value hierarchy, which are described as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:1%; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Level 1
</B>
	&#151;Quoted prices in active markets for identical assets or liabilities
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:1%; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Level 2
</B>
	&#151;Quoted prices for similar assets and liabilities in active markets or inputs that are observable
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:1%; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Level 3
</B>
	&#151;Inputs that are unobservable (for example, cash flow modeling inputs based on management&#146;s assumptions)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The assets&#146; or liabilities&#146; fair value measurement level within the fair value hierarchy is based on the lowest level of any input that is significant to the
	fair value measurement. The Company&#146;s Level 2 instruments consist of foreign currency forward contracts for which fair values were based on market prices obtained from independent brokers or determined using quantitative models that use as
	their basis readily observable market parameters that are actively quoted and can be validated through external sources, including third-party pricing services, brokers and market transactions.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The following table sets forth the fair value of the Company&#146;s foreign currency forward contracts and bank debt by level within the fair value hierarchy (in
	thousands):
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D179389DS1A_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:16PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	J.A. Cosmetics Holdings, Inc. and subsidiaries
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:16PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Notes to consolidated financial statements
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The Company did not transfer any assets measured at fair value on a recurring basis to or from Level 2 for any of the
	periods presented.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:16PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Note 7&#151;Derivatives
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The Company generally uses
	forward contracts to economically hedge the impact of the variability in exchange rates on contracts with its suppliers in China for future purchases of inventories denominated in RMB. The Company does not designate any of the forward contracts as
	hedges and does not apply hedge accounting. All forward contracts are recorded at fair value on the consolidated balance sheet. In the Predecessor 2014 Period, the Successor 2014 Period and the Successor 2015 Period, realized and unrealized losses
	of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	0.1 million,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	6.9 million and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	7.9 million, respectively, from the Company&#146;s forward contracts were recognized in other income (expense), net in the consolidated statements of operations and comprehensive income (loss).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The Company generally does not hedge the net assets of its international subsidiaries.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	As of December&nbsp;31, 2014 and December&nbsp;31, 2015, the aggregate notional amount of the Company&#146;s outstanding forward contracts was as follows (in thousands):
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The Company&#146;s derivative transactions are governed by ISDA Master Agreements, which include provisions governing the setoff of assets
	and liabilities between the parties. When the Company has more than one outstanding derivative transaction with a single counterparty, the setoff provisions contained within these agreements generally allow the non-defaulting party the right to
	reduce its liability to the defaulting party by amounts eligible for setoff as well as eligible offsetting transactions with that counterparty, irrespective of the currency, place of payment or booking office. The Company&#146;s policy is to present
	its derivative assets and derivative liabilities on the consolidated balance sheets on a net basis.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PX; ">
<TD COLSPAN="8" VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; BORDER-TOP:1.00PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:16PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Senior secured credit facility
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	In conjunction
	with the Company&#146;s acquisition of JACUS on January&nbsp;31, 2014, as discussed in Note 3, the Company entered into a 5 year,
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	125.0 million senior secured credit facility
	with a syndicate consisting of several large financial institutions. The facility consists of a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	20.0 million revolving line of credit (the &#147;Revolving Credit
	Facility&#148;) and a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	105.0 million term loan (the &#147;Term Loan&#148;).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The
	key terms of the Revolving Credit Facility and Term Loan were as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	All amounts under the Revolving Credit Facility are available for draw until the maturity
	date on January&nbsp;31, 2019. The Revolving Credit Facility is collateralized by substantially all of the Company&#146;s assets and has a commitment fee of 0.5% of unused balance, payable quarterly in arrears. The Revolving Credit Facility also
	provides for sub-facilities in the form of a
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	5.0 million letter of credit and a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	2.0 million swing
	line loan; however, all amounts under the Revolving Credit Facility cannot exceed
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	20.0 million. The unused balance of the Revolving Credit Facility as of
	December&nbsp;31, 2015 was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	12.3 million.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The Term Loan will mature on
	January&nbsp;31, 2019, and is collateralized by substantially all of the Company&#146;s assets. The Term Loan will be repaid in quarterly installments equal to 2.5%&nbsp;per year of the original principal with the remaining Term Loan balance due
	upon the maturity date. The Term Loan can be prepaid at any time without penalty and is subject to mandatory prepayments when there is (i)&nbsp;excess cash flow, (ii)&nbsp;asset dispositions that, individually, result in net proceeds in excess of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	1.0 million, or, in aggregate, in excess of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	2.0 million during a year, or (iii)&nbsp;issuance of
	additional debt. The Term Loan requires an annual administrative fee of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	50,000.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Aggregate future minimum principal payments on the Term Loan are as follows (in thousands):
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D179389DS1A_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:16PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	J.A. Cosmetics Holdings, Inc. and subsidiaries
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:16PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Notes to consolidated financial statements
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Both the Revolving Credit Facility and the Term Loan carry interest, at the Company&#146;s option, at (i)&nbsp;a rate
	per annum equal to the greater of Adjusted LIBOR (subject to a minimum floor of 1.25%) plus an applicable margin or (ii)&nbsp;a floating base rate plus an applicable margin. The interest rate on both the Revolving Credit Facility and the Term Loan
	was 6.25%&nbsp;per annum as of December&nbsp;31, 2014 and 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The Company incurred costs directly related to the senior secured credit facility of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	4.2 million, consisting primarily of underwriting fees of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	2.5 million, an upfront fee of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	1.3 million and legal fees of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	0.4 million, which were recorded as a reduction of the carrying amount of
	the debt and are being amortized over the term of the senior secured credit facility.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The Company is also subject to certain reporting and financial covenants
	to remain in good standing under the senior secured credit facility. As of December&nbsp;31, 2014 and 2015, the Company was in compliance with all financial covenants.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:16PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Second lien term loan
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	In conjunction with the above credit facility, the
	Company entered into a
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	40.0 million subordinated second lien term loan (the &#147;Second Lien Term Loan&#148;) also on January&nbsp;31, 2014. The Second Lien Term Loan does not
	require any principal payments until maturity on July&nbsp;31, 2019. The Second Lien Term Loan is secured by substantially all of the Company&#146;s assets but subordinated to the senior security credit facility. The Second Lien Term Loan requires
	prepayment penalties if prepaid prior to the maturity date, and not in conjunction with a change-in-control of the Company, in the amount of 4% of amounts prepaid in year one, 2% in year two and 1% in year three, and requires prepayment penalties of
	1% if prepaid on or prior to the end of year three in conjunction with a change-in-control. The Second Lien Term Loan carries interest equal to Adjusted LIBOR plus 10.0%&nbsp;per annum, with Adjusted LIBOR equal to the higher of (i)&nbsp;LIBOR for
	U.S. dollars, adjusted for customary Eurodollar reserve requirements, if any, and (ii)&nbsp;1.0%. As of December&nbsp;31, 2014 and 2015, the Second Lien Term Loan carried interest at a rate of 11%&nbsp;per annum.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The Company incurred costs directly related to the second lien term loan of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	1.1 million,
	consisting primarily of an upfront fee of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	0.8 million and legal fees of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	0.3 million, which
	were recorded as a reduction of the carrying amount of the debt and are being amortized over the term of the second lien term loan.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The Company recognized, in
	aggregate, interest expense of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	1.0 million and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	1.1 million related to the accretion of financing
	costs during the Successor 2014 Period and the Successor 2015 Period, respectively, and the remaining balance of the unamortized financing costs was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	4.3 million and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	3.2 million as of December&nbsp;31, 2014 and 2015, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The
	Predecessor recognized, in aggregate, interest expense of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	0.1 million on the outstanding balance under its term loan during the Predecessor 2014 Period. The outstanding balance
	under this term loan was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	29.8 million as of January&nbsp;31, 2014, and was repaid by the Company at the time of the acquisition.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:16PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Note 9&#151;Commitments and contingencies
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
<I>
	Operating leases
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The Company leases office, retail and warehouse space in New York, New Jersey, California and China from third parties under non-cancelable operating leases
	that provide for minimum base annual rental payments (excluding taxes and other charges). The leases expire between 2016 and 2025. Total rent expense was
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	0.1 million,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	1.9 million and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	3.0 million for the Predecessor 2014 Period, the Successor 2014 Period and the Successor
	2015 Period, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	JACUS subleases a small portion of a facility at Saddle Brook, New Jersey to a relative of a former executive officer of the
	Company, through 2016 with yearly rental commitments under this sublease in the range of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	60,000 to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	65,000.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-21
</P>

	From time to time, the
	Company may become involved in legal proceedings, claims, and litigation arising in the ordinary course of business. Management is not currently aware of any matters that it expects will have a material adverse effect on the Company&#146;s
	consolidated financial position, results of operations or cash flows.

	Table of Contents

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:16PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	J.A. Cosmetics Holdings, Inc. and subsidiaries
</B>
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	If all of the Company&#146;s unrecognized tax benefits as of December&nbsp;31, 2014 and December&nbsp;31, 2015 were recognized,
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	0.6 million and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	1.0 million of unrecognized tax benefits, respectively, would affect the effective tax
	rate. The Company does not expect any significant changes to the amount of unrecognized tax benefits in the next twelve months.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	In connection with the
	adoption of the above provisions, the Company recognizes interest and penalties accrued related to unrecognized tax benefits in the provision for income taxes. The Company had
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	0
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	31,000 of accrued gross interest and penalties as of December&nbsp;31, 2014 and December&nbsp;31, 2015, respectively. The Company recognized net interest expense of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	20,000 for the Successor 2015 Period. The Company did not recognize any net interest expense during the Predecessor 2014 Period and the Successor 2014 Period.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The Company files income tax returns in the U.S. federal jurisdiction and various state and foreign jurisdictions. As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, with few exceptions, the
	Company or its subsidiaries are no longer subject to examination prior to tax year 2012. Certain state returns are currently under audit by the state tax authorities. The Company does not expect the results of these audits to have a material impact
	on the consolidated financial statements.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:16PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Note 11&#151;Convertible preferred stock
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The Company has authorized 200,000 shares of convertible preferred stock for issuance with a par value of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	0.01 per share. In conjunction with the acquisition of the Predecessor, 135,041 shares of convertible preferred stock were issued for a total consideration of approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	135.0 million. At December&nbsp;31, 2014 and 2015, 135,041 shares of convertible preferred stock were issued and outstanding.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The
	Company&#146;s convertible preferred stock has been classified as temporary equity in the accompanying consolidated balance sheets in accordance with ASC 480,
<I>
	Distinguishing Liabilities from Equity
</I>
	, as the convertible preferred stock is
	redeemable at the option of the holder and is also redeemable, if not converted to common stock, at the time of an IPO. In conjunction with this classification, the Company has accreted the carrying value of the convertible preferred stock to
	reflect its maximum redemption amount as of December&nbsp;31, 2014 and 2015, respectively. The maximum redemption amount is the
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-25
</P>

	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:16PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	J.A. Cosmetics Holdings, Inc. and subsidiaries
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:16PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Notes to consolidated financial statements
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	greater of the convertible preferred stock liquidation value (including dividends) or the as-converted value based on the per share common stock price. The Company accounts for the accretion of
	convertible preferred stock as a reduction from amounts available for distribution to common stockholders.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The holders of the convertible preferred stock have the
	following rights, preferences and privileges:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
<I>
	Voting
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The holders
	of the convertible preferred stock are entitled to the number of votes equal to the number of shares of common stock into which such convertible preferred stock is convertible.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
<I>
	Conversion rights
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Holders of preferred stock may convert all or any
	portion of the convertible preferred stock into common stock at any time. The number of shares of common stock to be issued upon conversion of the convertible preferred stock will be determined by multiplying the number of shares of convertible
	preferred stock to be converted by
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	1,000 and dividing the result by the conversion price then in effect at that time, but is subject to downward revision if the Company
	subsequently issues dilutive securities at a lower than market price. As of December&nbsp;31, 2014 and 2015, the conversion price was equal to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	3.62 but is subject to
	adjustment upon any standard stock-splits, stock dividends or recapitalization of the Company.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
<I>
	Dividend rights
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Holders of the convertible preferred stock are entitled to receive cumulative dividends at the rate of 8%&nbsp;per annum of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	1,000 plus all accumulated and unpaid dividends, if and when declared by the board of directors.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
<I>
	Liquidation preferences
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Upon any liquidation, dissolution or winding-up of the Company, whether voluntary or involuntary, holders of the convertible preferred stock are entitled to
	be paid the greater of (i) the liquidation value plus all accrued and unpaid dividends (the &#147;liquidation value&#148;) or (ii) the amount to which the holder would be entitled to receive upon liquidation or winding-up of the Company, if all
	shares of convertible preferred stock converted to common stock (the &#147;conversion value&#148;). For the Successor 2014 Period, the Company accreted
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	10.3 million, which
	represents dividends at the rate of 8%&nbsp;per annum. For the Successor 2015 Period, the Company accreted
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	52.0 million, which represents the conversion value.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
<I>
	Redemption rights
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The Company may redeem, at any time prior
	to the potential IPO, any portion of the convertible preferred stock then outstanding provided no redemption may be made for less than
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	25.0 million, and shall redeem all
	outstanding convertible preferred stock on occurrence of the Company&#146;s potential IPO. Upon redemption, the Company shall pay the greater of (i)&nbsp;the liquidation value or ii) the conversion value.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:16PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Note 12&#151;Stock-based compensation
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The Company grants stock-based awards
	under its 2014 Equity Incentive Plan (the Plan). The Plan permits the grant of incentive stock options, non-statutory stock options, restricted stock and other stock- or cash-based awards to employees, officers, directors, advisors and consultants.
	The Plan allows for option grants of the Company&#146;s common stock based on time, performance and market conditions. There were a total of 8,172,067 shares and 9,460,556 shares reserved for grant under the Plan as of December&nbsp;31, 2014 and
	2015, respectively. 1,595,553 shares and 607,276 shares remained available for future issuance under the Plan as of December&nbsp;31, 2014 and 2015, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-26
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage173"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:7.5PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

	(1)
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The number of shares subject to options expected to vest takes into account an estimate of expected forfeitures.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The
	weighted-average grant date fair value of stock options granted during the Successor 2014 Period and Successor 2015 Period was
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	0.60 and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	0.99 per share, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	There was no stock-based compensation expense
	recognized in the Predecessor 2014 Period. Stock-based compensation cost recorded in the Successor 2014 Period and in the Successor 2015 Period was
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	0.3 million and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	0.5 million, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, there was
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	1.9 million of total unrecognized compensation cost related to non-vested share-based compensation, which is expected to be recognized over the remaining weighted-average vesting
	period of 3.8 years.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The intrinsic value of options vested and expected to vest and become exercisable is calculated based on the difference between the
	exercise price and the fair value of the Company&#146;s common stock as of December&nbsp;31, 2014 and 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	During 2014, the Company estimated the grant date fair
	value of stock options granted pursuant to the Plan by first computing the fair value using a Black-Scholes option-pricing model under three potential liquidity scenarios and then applying a probability weighting of each scenario. The estimated
	grant date fair value includes the following weighted-average assumptions as of December&nbsp;31, 2014 and 2015, with each assumption reflecting the weighting that was assigned to each scenario:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<A NAME="eolPage174"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D179389DS1A_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:16PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	J.A. Cosmetics Holdings, Inc. and subsidiaries
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:16PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Notes to consolidated financial statements
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The determination of the fair value of stock options on the date of grant using a Black-Scholes option-pricing model is
	affected by the estimated fair value of the underlying common stock, as well as assumptions regarding a number of variables that are complex, subjective and generally require significant judgment. The assumptions used in the Black-Scholes
	option-pricing model to calculate the fair value of stock options were:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
<I>
	Fair value of common stock
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The fair value of shares of common stock underlying the stock options has historically been the responsibility of and determined by the Company&#146;s board of directors,
	with input from management. Because there is no public market for the Company&#146;s common stock the board of directors determined the fair value of common stock at the time of grant of the option by considering a number of objective and subjective
	factors including independent third-party valuations of the Company&#146;s common stock, operating and financial performance, the lack of liquidity of capital stock and general and industry specific economic outlook, among other factors.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
<I>
	Expected term
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The expected term of the options represents the period of
	time that the options are expected to be outstanding. Options granted have a maximum contractual life of 10 years. The Company estimated the expected term of the option based on the estimated timing of potential liquidity events.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
<I>
	Expected volatility
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	As the Company does not have a trading history for
	its common stock, the expected stock price volatility for the common stock was estimated by taking the average historic price volatility for industry peers based on daily price observations over a period equivalent to the expected term of the stock
	option grants. Industry peers consist of several public companies within the same industry, which are of similar size, complexity and stage of development. The Company intends to continue to consistently apply this process using the same or similar
	public companies until a sufficient amount of historical information regarding the volatility of its own share price becomes available, or unless circumstances change such that the identified companies are no longer similar to the Company, in which
	case, more suitable companies whose share prices are publicly available would be used in the calculation.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
<I>
	Risk-free interest rate
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The risk-free interest rate was based on the U.S. Treasury rate, with maturities similar to the expected term of the options.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
<I>
	Expected dividend yield
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The Company does not anticipate paying any
	dividends in the foreseeable future. As such, the Company uses an expected dividend yield of zero.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	In addition to the Black-Scholes assumptions discussed immediately
	above, the forfeiture rate of stock options is estimated at the time of grant and revised in subsequent periods if actual forfeitures differ from those estimates. The Company records stock-based compensation expense only for those awards that are
	expected to vest.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-28
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage175"></A>

<TR BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:1.00EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.00EM; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Balance as of December&nbsp;31, 2015
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; ">

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; ">
	4,848,869
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; ">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; ">
	$
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; ">
	3.64
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; ">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>

<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">

	&nbsp;

<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" ALIGN="RIGHT">

	8.6
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; ">

</FONT>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; ">
	8,036
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; ">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PX; ">
<TD COLSPAN="16" VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; BORDER-TOP:1.00PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>

</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	For the Company&#146;s performance-based options, in addition to the service condition, the ultimate number of shares to be earned depends
	on the achievement of both a performance and market condition. The performance condition is based on the occurrence of a liquidity event (e.g., initial public offering or change-in-control transaction). The market condition is based upon the
	achievement of a minimum rate of return from the liquidity event. In regards to the performance condition, awards granted prior to August 2015 generally provided that if the liquidity event occurs prior to January&nbsp;31, 2016, the option holder is
	entitled to an additional number of shares assuming the minimum rate of return is achieved. No liquidity event occurred prior to January 31, 2016.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The
	weighted-average grant date fair value of performance-based options granted during the Successor 2014 Period and Successor 2015 Period was
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	0.40 and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	0.50 per share, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The fair values were determined using a Monte Carlo simulation
	model, based on rate of return from a potential liquidity event that ranges from 3.0x to 6.5x. The rate of return is defined as the aggregate amount of distribution, dividends and sales proceeds received by equity holders, in a liquidity event,
	divided by the aggregate amount of original capital contribution made by these equity holders as of January&nbsp;31, 2014. The model assumed a 16% chance of a change-in-control in the near term (nine months), a 24% chance of a change-in-control in
	the long term and a 60% chance of an initial public offering.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Because the achievement of the performance condition is not probable until a liquidity event (e.g.,
	initial public offering or a change-in-control transaction) has occurred, no compensation expense was recognized during the Successor 2014 Period and the Successor 2015 Period, related to these performance-based options. As of December&nbsp;31,
	2015, there was
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	1.7 million of unrecognized stock-based compensation related to unvested performance-based awards.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:16PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Phantom shares
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	On November&nbsp;14, 2014, the Company adopted the J.A.
	Cosmetics Holdings, Inc. 2014 Phantom Equity Plan (the &#147;Phantom Plan&#148;). The Phantom Plan authorizes the grant of up to 220,800 units of phantom equity to employees, directors and consultants of the Company and any of its subsidiaries. The
	phantom shares each represent a contractual right to payment of compensation in the future based on the amounts distributable to a holder of the Company&#146;s common stock in connection with a sale of the Company (defined below), less the exercise
	price. The phantom shares do not represent shares of the Company&#146;s common stock, and a recipient of phantom shares does not receive an ownership interest in the Company, stockholder voting rights or other incidents of ownership to the
	Company&#146;s common stock.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-29
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage176"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D179389DS1A_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:16PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	J.A. Cosmetics Holdings, Inc. and subsidiaries
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:16PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Notes to consolidated financial statements
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The phantom shares vest immediately on sale of the majority of the Company&#146;s outstanding common stock or
	substantially all of the Company&#146;s assets (&#147;sale of the Company&#148;), and the phantom stockholder remains continuously employed by the Company from the date of grant through the date of a sale of the Company. Upon a sale of the Company,
	holders of a vested phantom share will receive a one-time cash payment in an amount equal to the difference between the fair market value of the amounts to be received by a holder of a share of the Company&#146;s common stock in connection with the
	sale of the Company and the fair market value of a share of the Company&#146;s common stock on the grant date, as set forth in the phantom shares award agreement. During the Successor 2014 Period and the Successor 2015 Period, the Company granted
	131,100 and 62,100 phantom shares, respectively. As a cash payment is triggered only upon a sale of the Company, no compensation expense was recognized during the Successor 2014 Period and the Successor 2015 Period, related to these phantom shares.
	As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, there was
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	0.3 million of unrecognized stock-based compensation related to the phantom shares; that cost is expected to be recognized upon sale of
	the Company.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:16PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Note 13&#151;Employee benefit plan
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The Company
	maintains a defined contribution 401(k) profit-sharing plan (the &#147;401(k) Plan&#148;) for eligible employees who are over the age of 21. Participants may make voluntary contributions up to the maximum amount allowable by law. The Company may
	make contributions to the 401(k) Plan on a discretionary basis which vest to the participants 100%. The Company elected not to make any contributions to the 401(k) Plan during the Successor 2014 Period. The Company made
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	18,000 of matching contributions to the 401(k) Plan during the Successor 2015 Period. The Predecessor elected not to make any contributions to the 401(k) Plan during the
	Predecessor 2014 Period.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:16PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Note 14&#151;Related-party transactions
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
<I>
	Successor
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The Company rents office space in Shanghai, China from a
	lessor who is also an employee of the Company. During the Successor 2014 Period, the Company incurred
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	0.4 million in rent expense to this lessor, which is included under
	selling, general and administrative expenses. As of December&nbsp;31, 2014, the Company had a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	32,000 security deposit included in other current assets related to this
	lease. Further, as of December&nbsp;31, 2014, the Company owed
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	0.8 million for consulting services to entities owned by this employee. In 2015, the employee ceased
	employment with the Company, and the lease was terminated; therefore these transactions were no longer disclosed as related-party transactions during the Successor 2015 Period.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Cosmopack and Promotions Plus, each a related party entity owned by a relative of a former executive officer, manage the Company&#146;s distribution and fulfillment
	operations for the New Jersey warehouse and charge the Company for these services. During the Successor 2014 Period, the Company incurred
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	3.7 million for these services, which
	is reflected in selling, general and administrative expenses in the consolidated statement of operations. At December&nbsp;31, 2014, the Company owed
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	0.3&nbsp;million to
	these entities, and the balances have been included in due to related parties in the consolidated balance sheet. The former executive officer was an employee until December&nbsp;31, 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	During the Successor 2014 Period and the Successor 2015 Period, the Company incurred
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	0.8 million
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	0.9 million, respectively, in management and consulting fees to its majority stockholder, TPG. Amounts owed are included in due to related parties in the consolidated
	balance sheet.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
<I>
	Predecessor
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The Predecessor rented office
	space in Shanghai, China from a lessor who is also an employee of JACUS. During the Predecessor 2014 Period, the Predecessor incurred
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	36,000 in rent expense to this lessor,
	which is included under selling, general and administrative expenses.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Cosmopack and Promotions Plus, each a related party entity owned by a relative of a
	former executive officer, manage JACUS&#146;s distribution and fulfillment operations for the New Jersey warehouse and charges JACUS for these services. During the Predecessor 2014 Period, the Predecessor incurred
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	0.4 million for these services, which is reflected in selling, general
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;

<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">

	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:16PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	J.A. Cosmetics Holdings, Inc. and subsidiaries
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:16PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Notes to consolidated financial statements
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
<I>
	Unaudited pro forma net income per share
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The unaudited pro forma net income per share reflects (i) the application of the proceeds from the sale of 4,000,000&nbsp;shares from the proposed IPO (assuming the
	mid-point of the IPO price range) that are necessary to cover a portion of the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	72&nbsp;million dividend paid to stockholders on June 7, 2016, which was in excess of the
	Company&#146;s historical earnings and (ii)&nbsp;the effect of conversion of the outstanding convertible preferred stock into common stock at the applicable conversion prices immediately prior to, and conditioned upon, the closing of this initial
	public offering.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The following table sets forth the computation of the Company&#146;s unaudited pro forma basic and diluted net income per share of common
	stock (in thousands except share and per share data):
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:16PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Note 16&#151;Subsequent events
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Management
	evaluates events occurring subsequent to the date of the financial statements in determining the accounting for and disclosure of transactions and events that affect the financial statements. Subsequent events have been evaluated through
	April&nbsp;28, 2016, which is the date that the financial statements were issued.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The Plan was amended in January 2016 to allow certain employees to exercise options
	prior to vesting (&#147;early exercise&#148;). Upon termination of employment prior to full vesting, unvested shares acquired through early exercise are forfeited and are repurchased by the Company at lower of the exercise price and fair market
	value. Therefore, such unvested options are treated as outstanding.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	In connection with the plan amendment in January 2016, the Company also extended loans to certain
	key management personnel (the &#147;Debtors&#146;&#148;) totaling
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	10.4 million (the &#147;2016 Notes&#148;). The 2016 Notes served as financing for the Debtors&#146; 2016
	exercise of previously issued stock options. The 2016 Notes are secured by the underlying shares and are full recourse to the respective Debtor&#146;s personal assets. The 2016 Notes carry interest at between 0.75%&nbsp;and 0.81% per annum, due
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-32
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage179"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D179389DS1A_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:16PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	J.A. Cosmetics Holdings, Inc. and subsidiaries
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:16PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Notes to consolidated financial statements
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	semi-annually, and mature in January 2018 or earlier upon the occurrence of certain events specified in the Note agreements. Amounts due from employees in relation to the 2016 Notes will be
	reduced from stockholders&#146; equity. Cash received from Debtors for early exercise of unvested options is treated as a liability. Amounts so recorded are transferred into common stock and additional paid-in capital as the shares vest.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The Company entered into new lease agreements for e.l.f. stores with a minimum future lease commitment amount of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	6.1&nbsp;million.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The Company entered into agreements with third parties to manage distribution and fulfillment operations at its
	Ontario, California warehouse. In addition to reimbursing the third parties for costs incurred to perform these services, the Company is obligated to pay fixed amounts totaling
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	0.7 million towards these services over a period of 14 months.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	With effect from
	April&nbsp;26, 2016, the name of the Company was changed from J.A. Cosmetics Holdings, Inc. to e.l.f. Beauty, Inc.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-33
</P>

<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The Supplemental Pro Forma Condensed Consolidated Balance Sheet as of June 30, 2016 reflects the conversion of all of our outstanding shares of convertible preferred stock into an aggregate of 37,271,375&nbsp;shares of
	common stock immediately prior to the consummation of the initial public offering (&#147;IPO&#148;) and the recognition of incremental compensation expense related to the acceleration of vesting on certain time-based vesting awards and satisfaction
	of the performance condition on certain performance-based vesting awards (the &#147;IPO related transactions&#148;).

	F-37
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage184"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D179389DS1A_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:16PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	e.l.f. Beauty, Inc. and subsidiaries
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:16PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
<A NAME="D179389DS1A_HTM_FIN179389_11">
</A>
	Notes to condensed consolidated financial statements (unaudited)
</B>
</P>
<EFX_NOTES_TO_FINANCIAL_STATEMENT>
<A NAME="FIS_NOTES_TO_FINANCIAL_STATEMENT"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Note 1&#151;Nature of operations
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	e.l.f. Beauty, Inc. and subsidiaries (the
	&#147;Company,&#148; &#147;we,&#148; &#147;us,&#148; &#147;its&#148; and &#147;our&#148;) was formed as a Delaware corporation on December 20, 2013 under the name J.A. Cosmetics Holdings, Inc. In April 2016, the Company changed its name to
	e.l.f.&nbsp;Beauty, Inc. The Company and its subsidiaries conduct business under the name e.l.f. Cosmetics, and offer high-quality, prestige-inspired products for eyes, lips and face to consumers through its retail customers, e.l.f. stores and
	e-commerce channels.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	On September 19, 2016, the Company amended and restated its certificate of incorporation to effect a 2.76:1 forward stock split of the
	Company&#146;s common stock, increase the number of shares of common stock authorized for issuance to 250.0 million, allow for conversion of preferred stock into common stock prior to an initial public offering and at a ratio that has been adjusted
	to reflect the effects of the stock split, and address a variety of other corporate governance matters. There was no change in the par value of the Company&#146;s common stock. All common shares, stock options, and per share information presented in
	the financial statements have been adjusted to reflect the stock split on a retroactive basis for all periods presented.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:16PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
<I>
	Recapitalization
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	On June 7, 2016, the Company incurred an incremental
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#036;
</FONT>
	64&nbsp;million in term loan borrowings under the Senior Secured Credit
	Facility to fund, in part, a
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#036;
</FONT>
	72&nbsp;million special dividend to stockholders, and increased the total availability under the Revolving Credit Facility to
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#036;
</FONT>
	25&nbsp;million. In connection with the incremental borrowings, certain covenants were amended to reflect the increased leverage. All common stockholders, including individuals that received shares of
	restricted common stock in connection with the early exercise of certain unvested stock options, received a dividend of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#036;
</FONT>
	1.79 per share. The
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#036;
</FONT>
	4&nbsp;million in
	dividend payments made to restricted common stockholders was immediately used by them to pay down their outstanding borrowings from the Company, pursuant to their underlying recourse note agreements. Accordingly, the net cash outflow related to the
	dividend was
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#036;
</FONT>
	68 million. See Note&nbsp;8 to the Unaudited Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements included elsewhere in this prospectus for more information regarding the early exercise of unvested
	stock options by restricted common stockholders.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Finally, in connection with the special dividend, the Company modified all stock options outstanding and reduced the
	exercise price by
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#036;
</FONT>
	1.79 per share in order to protect the option holders from dilution that would have otherwise resulted from the dividend recapitalization transaction. This constituted a modification in
	accordance with ASC&nbsp;718,
<I>
	Compensation&#151;stock compensation
</I>
	and, accordingly,
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	&#036;
</FONT>
	0.7&nbsp;million of incremental stock-based compensation expense was recorded during the three months ended June
	30, 2016.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:16PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Note 2&#151;Summary of significant accounting policies
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
<I>
	Basis of presentation
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The accompanying unaudited condensed consolidated
	financial statements and related notes have been prepared in accordance with U.S. generally accepted accounting principles (&#147;US GAAP&#148;) for interim financial information and pursuant to the rules and regulations of the Securities and
	Exchange Commission (the &#147;SEC&#148;). In the opinion of the Company, these interim financial statements contain all adjustments, consisting of only normal recurring adjustments, necessary for a fair statement of its financial position as of
	June 30, 2016, and its results of operations for the six months ended June 30, 2016, and cash flows for the six months ended June 30, 2016. The condensed consolidated balance sheet at December 31, 2015, was derived from audited annual financial
	statements, but does not contain all of the footnote disclosures from the annual financial statements. All intercompany balances and transactions have been eliminated in consolidation.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	These interim condensed consolidated financial statements should be read in conjunction with the audited Consolidated Financial Statements as of and for the year ended
	December 31, 2015 and related notes included in this prospectus. Operating results for the interim periods are not necessarily indicative of the results that may be expected for the full year.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-38

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
<I>
	Use of estimates
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The
	preparation of the accompanying financial statements in conformity with US GAAP requires management to make estimates and assumptions that affect the amounts reported in the financial statements and the accompanying notes. Actual results could
	differ from these estimates.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:16PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
<I>
	Segment reporting
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Operating segments
	are components of an enterprise for which separate financial information is available that is evaluated by the chief operating decision maker in deciding how to allocate resources and in assessing performance. Utilizing these criteria, the Company
	manages its business on the basis of one operating segment and one reportable segment.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
<I>
	Significant accounting policies
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The Company made no changes to the significant accounting policies that were disclosed in Note 2, &#147;Summary of significant accounting policies,&#148; to the audited
	Consolidated Financial Statements as of and for the year ended December 31, 2015 included in this prospectus. The Company has prepared the accompanying unaudited condensed consolidated financial statements on the same basis as the audited financial
	statements included in this prospectus.
</P>

<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	ASU 2014-09,
<I>
	Revenue from Contracts with Customers
<BR>
	(Topic 606)
</I>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	The standard will replace existing revenue recognition standards and significantly expand the disclosure requirements for revenue arrangements. It may be adopted either retrospectively or on a modified retrospective basis to new
	contracts and existing contracts with remaining performance obligations as of the effective date.
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	January 1, 2018
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	The Company is currently evaluating the alternative methods of adoption and the effect on its financial statements and related disclosures.
</TD>
